content.description:
Dido in Love

Uritururo, -ere = ardeo, -ere infelix Dido totaque vagaturvagor, -ari = erro, -are 
urbe furensfuro, -ere: to rave, qualis coniectaconicio, -ere, -ieci, -iectum = pulso, -are cervacerva, -ae, f.: deer sagittasagitta, -ae, f.: arrow, 
quam procul incautamincautus, -a, -um, adj.: unguarded nemora inter CresiaCresius, -a, -um, adj.: of Crete (a Greek island) fixitfigo, -ere, fixi: to pierce 
pastorpastor, -oris, m.: shepherd agens telis liquitlinquo, -ere, liqui = relinquo, -ereque volatilevolatilis, -e, adj.: flying ferrum 

Line 5nesciusnescius, -a, -um, adj.: unaware.
content.question: The metrical pattern of the first four feet of line 3 (quam...fixit) is
